plugins.name: Auto Select
plugins.description:
Auto Select is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your workflow by providing advanced selection tools. With Auto Select, you can easily select objects by name and hierarchy, making it effortless to navigate and manipulate complex designs. Whether you're working on a small project or a large-scale design system, Auto Select is the perfect companion to enhance your productivity and creativity in Figma.


Key Features:


Select objects by name: Quickly find and select objects by entering their names.

Select parent and child layers: Navigate through the hierarchy of your design by selecting parent or child layers.

Undo selection: Easily undo selections to refine your choices.

Select all: Select all objects in your current Figma canvas with a single click.

Close plugin: Close the plugin window when you're done selecting objects.


You can select child layers of selected object and then parent layer of selected child layer .


How to Use:


Enter the name of the object you want to select in the input field.

Click on the "Select Object" button to select the object.

Use the other buttons to perform various selection actions, such as selecting all objects, selecting parent layers, selecting child layers, undoing selections, and closing the plugin.

Get Started with Auto Select today and take your Figma workflow to the next level!
plugins.tagline: "Effortless Selection, Seamless Design: Auto Select simplifies your Figma workflow."

plugins.name: export2md-list
plugins.description:
Export2md-list plugin for FigJam allows users to select nodes on a FigJam file and convert them into a neatly formatted Markdown list. It supports nested lists and sections, reflecting the structure of the original FigJam content. Once the list is generated, it can be copied to the clipboard with a single click.



Source — https://github.com/midler/export2md-list

plugins.name: Custom Text Linter
plugins.description:
カスタム可能な用語一覧を元にテキストをチェックします。


テキストチェックの方法

  1. Figma、FigJam、Figma Slides 内でチェックしたいページを開きます。
  2. プラグインを起動し「ページをチェック」を押します。
  3. チェック結果が表示され、非推奨用語が含まれているレイヤーのリストが確認できます。
  4. 問題のある用語をクリックすると、該当するテキストレイヤーにフォーカスします。


用語一覧の更新方法

  1. 用語一覧を更新したい場合は「用語一覧の更新」 セクションを展開します。
  2. 用語一覧のCSVファイルを選択し、「CSVファイルをインポート」ボタンを押します。
  3. CSVには以下の列を含めます。
  4. recommended: 推奨される用語 （カンマ区切り）
  5. deprecated: 避けるべき用語 （カンマ区切り）
  6. message: 用語についての説明
  7. url: 参照リンク（任意）
  8. インポートが成功すると、ファイル名と日付が更新されます。


----


Checks text using a customizable term list.


How to Check Text

  1. Open the page you want to check in Figma, FigJam, or Figma Slides.
  2. Launch the plugin and click the “Check this page” button.
  3. The check results will be displayed, showing a list of text layers containing deprecated terms.
  4. Clicking on a flagged term will automatically focus on the corresponding text layer in the Figma page.


How to Update the Terms List

  1. If you want to update the terms list, expand the “Update Terms” section.
  2. Click the “Import CSV” button and select a CSV file containing the updated terms list.
  3. The CSV file should include the following columns:
  4. recommended: Preferred terms
  5. deprecated: Terms to avoid
  6. message: Explanation or corrective action
  7. url: Reference link (optional)
  8. Once the import is successful, the file name and date will be updated.

accepted.name: Shingo Suzuki
accepted.description:
Lead Designer / Interaction Designer
TSUMIKI INC.

plugins.tagline: Checks text using a customizable term list.

plugins.name: AI Page Manager
plugins.description:
AI Page Manager is a powerful Figma plugin designed to streamline your page management workflow. With this tool, you can effortlessly rename, add, delete, and reorder pages in your Figma file, all from a single, intuitive interface.


Key features:

1. Batch Rename: Quickly rename multiple pages at once.

2. Add Pages: Create new pages with custom names in just a few clicks.

3. Delete Pages: Remove unwanted pages easily and safely.

4. Reorder Pages: Drag and drop to rearrange your pages in any order you prefer.

5. Add Separators: Organise your pages with visual separators for better structure.

6. Refresh: Sync your plugin view with the latest changes in your Figma file.


How to use:

1. Open the plugin to see a list of all pages in your current Figma file.

2. To rename a page, simply type the new name in the input field next to the current page name.

3. To add a new page, click the "+" button and enter a name for your new page.

4. To delete a page, click the trash can icon next to the page you want to remove.

5. To reorder pages, drag and drop the pages into your desired sequence.

6. To add a separator, click the "Add Separator" button.

7. Once you've made your changes, click "Apply Changes" to update your Figma file.

8. Use the refresh button to sync the plugin with any external changes made to your file.


The AI Page Manager also includes a teaser for upcoming AI-powered features, hinting at future enhancements that will make your page management even more efficient.


Whether you're working on a small project or a complex design system with numerous pages, AI Page Manager helps you keep your Figma files organized and your workflow smooth. Say goodbye to tedious page management and hello to a more productive design process!
plugins.tagline: Easily rename, add, delete and reorder pages in your Figma file.

plugins.name: Component Pro
plugins.description:
To improve my work efficiency, especially in mastering the Component, I made this plugin. It contains many enhancements for Figma’s Component and Instance features.


Just to be clear, I am not very good at HTML and TypeScript, some code was written by chatGPT, so welcome to feedback by sending mail to woshixwn@gmail.com.


Here is a detailed introduction to each function of the plugin.


Track Com/Ins

Change the current selection to correspond to the Component/Instance.

You need to select some instances or components first. For instances, run this function will change selection to their main components, but will not change viewport. For components, will select corresponding instances.

Of course, corresponding components/instances need to be in the same page.


Track Brothers

Find instances with the same main component.

Select Instances, and run this function, all instances that has the main component will be selected.

Be aware that if the page has many layers, it may take a lot of time.


Clone & Inherit

Batch replace layers with specific instance.

First, Select a component or an instance named “master”.

Second, select more layers.

Third, run the function, and the layers selected in 2nd step will replace to 1st step’s instance (create by component or clone by ‘master’ instance).

If you choose to select other instances in 2nd step, if it has the same properties as 1st step component/instance, replaced instance will keep the value.


Text2Instances

Batch replace text layers with specific instance.

This function is a lot like ‘’Clone & Inherit’, but the layers be replaced need to be text or a combination of texts.

For example, select a component which has 2 text properties, and select a frame contains 2 text layers, then run this function, the frame will be replace to instance created by component, with text properties being assigned to characters of those 2 text layers.


Fully Detach

Detach an instance and the instance inside

I think the description is simple enough, but just in case, let me give an example.

If you have an instance, it has 2 sub-layer, all is instance. Once you run this function, instance and its sub-instances will all be detached.

By the way, the layer that is hidden will be removed, otherwise it looks to mess.


Update ins Inside

Select all instances can be updated

Select some Frames, Groups, Components or even Instances first. Running this function will find out all instances belong to those that can be updated.

Noticed, It may take a long time to analysis each instance type sub-layers, I still try to improve that.


Comp Selection

Make selection a component

This function will make it a component by your selection, replace the selection with an instance that created by the new component.

Make sure that all selection are belong to the same parent.


--------


Next, some features may not exactly made for component, but they also useful(and I really don’t want to code another plugin).


Auto Rename

Rename selected layers and their sub-layers


Swap Layer

Exchange the position of selected layers


Make Max

Quickly set the size of selected layer to their parents’ size.


Sort Layer

Change the order in left side panel of selected layers by their position.


Perfect Corner

Quickly set selected layers’ independent corners to 60%(iOS like).


Round Pixel

Round layer’s position and width/height to Pixel


Adjust Outer Size

Adjust Component Set, Section, Frame’s size according to their sublayers.

I know Figma has its own official feature, but I made an adjustment, the adjust margin will choose the minimum value.



That's all for now, I guess.
plugins.tagline: Component, Instance, Enhancement

103754.release_notes:
I add some ux improvement in this version:

1. List item(Like 'Track Components') now is only enable when available layers are selected. For example, if you select a component, you can't click "Track Components" now. Reducing the risk to click wrong feature.
2. Split "Track Com/Ins" into 2 functions, Track Components and Track Instances. The reason is the same as above.
3. Add new feature, Clone Main Comp, it will clone main components of instances selected.
4. Update ins inside now has a loading state when analysis layers, cause it may take long time.
5. texts2instances now support nested instances
6. I add each function to menu's sub-menu, so you can use command+/ then type function name to quick execute it.

plugins.name: mucopy
plugins.description:
MuCopy: Revolutionize Your UX Writing with AI


Say goodbye to "Lorem Ipsum" and hello to MuCopy, the future of UX writing in Figma. Powered by GPT-4 and advanced language models, MuCopy is designed to transform the way you write and design user interfaces. Whether you're crafting tooltips, buttons, or entire dialogue boxes, MuCopy assists in generating concise, relevant, and engaging microcopy that fits perfectly into your designs.


Key Features:

  • AI-Driven Writing Assistant: Leverage the power of GPT-4 for generating creative, contextually relevant text.
  • Seamless Integration: Works within Figma, allowing you to write and edit copy directly on your designs.
  • Time-Saving: Say goodbye to writer's block and reduce the time spent on writing and editing copy.
  • Customizable: Tailor the suggestions to fit your brand voice and style guidelines.
  • Collaborative: Ideal for teams, ensuring consistent and effective communication across your designs.


Whether you're a UX writer, designer, or a team looking to streamline your design process, MuCopy is your go-to plugin for creating microcopy that resonates with users and elevates your designs.

plugins.name: Sticky Status
plugins.description:
Status block for frames or components to assist in project status tracking and status note taking. This plugin allows you to add a block that is attached to your page/frame to allows you to set a status and leave comments/notes about the status.


The following statuses are supported currently:

  • Draft
  • In Progress
  • Ready for Review
  • Under Review
  • Approved
  • Ready for Development
  • Not Needed


NOTE: At this time, this plugin will not work with instances. Instances don't allow modification so the plugin is unable to add the status widget to the frame. In order to make this work, you can wrap your instance in a frame and then apply the status. You can add an auto-layout with all 0s for spacing and it will not impact the layout or design.
plugins.tagline: Sticky status blocks for frames and components.

plugins.name: dixma
plugins.description:
What is Dixma?

Dixma is a 4-12 player storytelling party game in Figma, inspired by the the card game Dixit.

Video Walkthrough (YouTube)


Game Board Required:

https://www.figma.com/community/file/889925301071649823


Game Rules

Each round all players have 6 random cards. The storyteller for the round shares a clue about one of their cards, and every other player picks their card that best fits the storyteller's story. The cards are revealed and all the players (other than the storyteller) guess which card they think is the storyteller's.


Scoring

If ALL players find the Storyteller’s card,

or NO players find the Storyteller’s card:

Storyteller: 0 points 
Other players: 2 points  


If at least one player but not all players find the card: 

Storyteller: 3 points 
Players who have found the card: 3 points 


In either case:

+1 bonus point per vote on your card if you
 are not the storyteller, up to 3 per round.


GitHub: https://github.com/brettlyne/dixma

https://www.figma.com/community/file/889925301071649823


Game Rules

Each round all players have 6 random cards. The storyteller for the round shares a clue about one of their cards, and every other player picks their card that best fits the storyteller's story. The cards are revealed and all the players (other than the storyteller) guess which card they think is the storyteller's.


Scoring

If ALL players find the Storyteller’s card,

or NO players find the Storyteller’s card:

Storyteller: 0 points 
Other players: 2 points  


If at least one player but not all players find the card: 

Storyteller: 3 points 
Players who have found the card: 3 points 


In either case:

+1 bonus point per vote on your card if you
 are not the storyteller, up to 3 per round.


GitHub: https://github.com/brettlyne/dixma

plugins.name: 中文文本样式替换 CN Auto Adapt Helper
plugins.description:
介绍

CN Auto Adapt Helper 是一款支持 Figma 中文与英文文本样式一键切换的插件，助力跨语言界面设计快速适配。


功能说明

  1. 自动识别英文样式并替换为中文样式
  2. 支持单行与多行文本样式替换
  3. 保持原有文本结构与排版不变
  4. 一键切换中文/英文模式，操作可逆
  5. 实时显示处理统计和失败信息


使用方法

  1. 选中一个或多个包含文本样式的图层或组件
  2. 点击“切换中文模式”或“切换英文模式”按钮
  3. 插件将自动完成样式匹配与替换
  4. 处理结果将在底部统计区域展示


注意事项

  1. 仅对存在样式 ID 的文本图层生效
  2. 样式命名需符合设计规范中中英命名映射关系
  3. 若未匹配成功则可能跳过或统计为失败项


Introduction

CN Auto Adapt Helper helps you automatically switch between English and Chinese text styles in Figma, streamlining multilingual UI design.


Function Description

  1. Automatically replaces text styles based on language mode
  2. Supports both single and multi-line styles
  3. Keeps text structure and layout unchanged
  4. One-click toggle between CN and EN modes
  5. Real-time processing stats and error tracking


How to Use

  1. Select one or more text layers or components.
  2. Click “Switch to Chinese Mode” or “Switch to English Mode”.
  3. Plugin will automatically match and replace the corresponding text styles.
  4. View results in the statistics panel.


Notes

  1. Only works when text layers have recognized style IDs.
  2. Style name mappings must align with your design system’s naming convention.
  3. Fallback may occur if the style ID is missing or not matched.

accepted.description: Everything gets a response, but nothing gets a resolution. 事事有回应，事事不答应。

plugins.name: Stream Screen Manager
plugins.description:
Stream Screen Manager revolutionizes the way fast food restaurants manage their digital signage displays. Created by Stream, a leading digital signage company, this Figma Plugin bridges the gap between design and dynamic content management for digital menu boards and drive-thrus. This innovative tool is designed to streamline the content management process, enabling restaurants to update their digital signage directly from Figma - the world’s premier design tool.

With Stream Screen Manager, users can effortlessly create captivating digital signage layouts tailored to their brand. The plugin facilitates real-time editing of menu pricing, text descriptions, photos, and more, ensuring that your digital displays always reflect the most current offerings and promotions. Whether you’re looking to make quick updates to your menu or overhaul your drive-thru’s digital experience, this plugin provides all the tools necessary to achieve your goals with ease.

Key Features:

Real-Time Content Management: Directly update menu items, prices, and promotions across all your digital signage from within Figma. Changes are reflected instantly on your displays, keeping your content fresh and engaging.

Seamless POS Integration: Streamline operations with our plugin’s ability to integrate directly with Point of Sale systems, ensuring price and menu item consistency across your digital displays and sales channels.

Customizable Templates: Access a library of customizable design templates specifically crafted for fast food restaurants, making it easy to maintain brand consistency across all your signage.

Drag-and-Drop Interface: Utilize Figma’s intuitive drag-and-drop interface to design your digital signage layouts. Easily add photos, text, and pricing information without needing advanced design skills.

Collaboration Made Simple: Collaborate in real-time with your team members on signage designs. Figma’s collaborative environment ensures that everyone can contribute to the final product, from marketers to graphic designers.

Stream Screen Manager is perfect for fast food restaurants looking to take control of their digital signage content with the flexibility and power of Figma. Say goodbye to outdated menus and hello to a dynamic, engaging customer experience with Stream Screen Manager. Transform your digital menu boards and drive-thrus today, and serve up the freshest content with ease.
plugins.tagline: Stream Screen Manager allows Stream customers to manage their digital signs via Figma

plugins.name: Layout - Tailwind CSS V4 Import & Export
plugins.description:
Layout is a powerful Figma plugin that transforms your design tokens into Tailwind CSS V4 compatible variables with just a few clicks. It creates a perfect bridge between your design system and development workflow.


Key Features:


  1. Import CSS Variables: Easily import existing CSS variables into Figma as design tokens
  2. Export to Tailwind CSS V4: Generate Tailwind CSS V4 compatible theme files from your Figma variables
  3. One-Click Tailwind Colors: Instantly add the complete Tailwind color palette to your Figma project
  4. Smart Variable Handling: Automatically processes color, typography, spacing, and shadow variables
  5. Preview Before Import: See exactly what variables will be created before importing them
  6. Intelligent Prefix Management: Automatically handles variable prefixes to ensure clean, consistent naming


Perfect For:

  1. Design teams working with developers using Tailwind CSS
  2. Creating and maintaining design systems
  3. Ensuring design-to-code consistency
  4. Streamlining the handoff process between design and development


Layout eliminates the tedious manual work of translating design tokens between Figma and code, saving you time and reducing errors. Keep your design system and code in perfect sync with this essential tool for modern design workflows.
plugins.tagline: Bridge Figma design tokens to the Tailwind CSS V4 config for perfect design-to-code harmony

plugins.name: Bezier Palette Studio
plugins.description:
Transform your design workflow with this intuitive color palette generator that creates harmonious and accessible color scales. Using advanced HSV color mapping and Bézier curves, this plugin helps you generate professional color palettes.


Key Features:

  1. Effortless Palette Generation
  2. Auto Naming: Generate intuitive color names automatically based on hue values, ensuring consistency and saving time.
  3. Customizable Steps: Choose the exact number of shades per swatch to suit your project needs.
  4. Powerful Bézier Curve Control
  5. Interactive Curve Editor: Adjust color transitions using an intuitive Bézier curve interface integrated with an HSV color picker for unprecedented accuracy.
  6. Predefined and Customizable Curves: Pick from pre-made curves or switch to free-hand mode for full creative freedom.
  7. Accessibility
  8. Contrast Ratio Analysis: Automatically assess each color's contrast ratio against black and white backgrounds to ensure accessibility compliance.
  9. Color Tokens: Assign unique identifiers to every shade for hassle-free referencing across your designs.
  10. Seamless Integration and Export
  11. Export Color Tokens: Export your palette as JSON tokens for integration into your design systems or development workflows.
  12. Figma Frame Export: Instantly export palettes as organized frames within the current page of your Figma file for easy sharing and collaboration.
  13. Style Creation: Create reusable styles directly in your Figma file with one click, streamlining your workflow.


This plugin is perfect for design systems, brand guidelines, or any project requiring consistent color scales. It streamlines the color creation process while ensuring your palettes meet professional quality standards.

Elevate your design process with an intelligent color generation that combines creative freedom with technical precision.
plugins.tagline: Shape Your Palette with Bézier Curves

plugins.name: Count Components
plugins.description:
日本語ver.

何ができる？

ファイル内のコンポーネントを多い順に並べてCSVに出力できる。

以下の時に便利。

  1. 再利用の多いコンポーネントから順番に実装したい
  2. 利用数の多いコンポーネントから改善優先度を考えたい


使い方

  1. コンポーネントを数えたいファイルに移動
  2. プラグインを起動
  3. PC のダウンローダーから csv ファイルをダウンロード


あまり全力で保守していませんので、お手柔らかに。

要望はコメントください👍

by ふるじゅん


English ver.

What can it do?

It can output to CSV in order of the number of components in a file.

This is useful in the following cases,


  1. You want to implement components in order of most frequently reused components.
  2. To consider the priority of improvement from the component with the highest number of use.


How to use

  1. Move to the file where you want to count components
  2. Launch the plugin
  3. Download the csv file from the downloader on your PC


We don’t do our best to maintain it very well, so please be easy on us. Please comment on any requests 👍

by Furujun

It can output to CSV in order of the number of components in a file.

How to use

  3. Download the csv file from the downloader on your PC


We don’t do our best to maintain it very well, so please be easy on us. Please comment on any requests 👍

plugins.name: exportLang.json
plugins.description:
This Figma plugin, named exportLang, streamlines the process of extracting static texts from Figma designs and generating variable names for these texts through ChatGPT. The workflow is as follows:


Data Retrieval:


The plugin reads a JSON file, exportLang.json, where users store static texts from their Figma designs.

Variable Name Assignment:


For each static text in the JSON file, the plugin generates a unique variable name. For example, if there are three texts, the variable names might be text1, text2, and text3.

ChatGPT Interaction:


Using the generated variable names and their corresponding static texts, the plugin communicates with ChatGPT. It sends prompts to ChatGPT, requesting translation of the static texts into variable names.

Response Handling:


The plugin receives responses from ChatGPT, containing suggested variable names. These responses are associated with the original static texts.

Output in JSON Format:


The final output is a JSON file containing a mapping between variable names and their respective static texts. This structured JSON output facilitates easy integration into users' Figma projects.
plugins.tagline: exportLang.json

plugins.name: Lucide Icons Importer from GitHub
plugins.description:
This plugin allows the user to import always the latest release of Lucide Icons directly from the official Lucide GitHub Repository.


Few steps for the best Lucide Icons experience:


  1. ⬆ - Available Folders to analize the Lucide repo and obtain only the folders where svg files are in.
  2. 🗂️ - Select the folder to import. I suggest "/icons" to get the main icons library.
  3. 𑿿 - Select the Icon Name Option between original name or with prefix.
  4. 🎛️ - Set Icon Size, Stroke Width, Color and, if you want test it through the WCAG Contrast Checker.
  5. 🪄 - Import the SVGs and wait for the magic.


Most important info:

  1. If you do your second icon import, the plugin will not replace your current library but will only check for differences and integrate the new icons. This way your projects will always be safe from unpleasant surprises ;)
  2. If the icon configuration is different from the one already present in your figma project, a new frame will be created to not overwrite other configurations.



* Let me know your feedback or bugfix requests. *
plugins.tagline: Import always the latest version of Lucide Icons

plugins.description:
Figma plugin that allows you to generate single/multiple SVG React & React Native components at once. Prepared as .eslint friendly and support parent color schemas with fill/stroke optimize


Features

  • Generate multiple components at once
  • Save each one or all as files
  • Expand props version
  • Typescript
  • With dimension or without dimensions (for responsive)
  • Icon
  • React Native
  • Ref
  • Memo
  • Prettier
  • Xmlns / Non-xmlns


To use SVGReactify

  1. Run the "SVGReactify - SVG Component Creator" plugin
  2. Highlight icon(s) in your Figma project
  3. Choose the settings of code you want to on left side.

plugins.name: Figma to React by Figroot
plugins.description:
Instantly turn Figma into a pixel-perfect, responsive React and Tailwind CSS website. Saves you 10x time, completely for free. This tool is intended for Design Engineers to speed up their workflow immensely.


Watch the demo video here.


Features

  1. Image download button for all images within the selection.
  2. Font support that automatically detects and adds the fonts needed.
  3. Tailwind custom config support for fonts (variables WIP).
  4. We are continuing to improve the experimental Responsive Screen setting.


How to use

  1. Click the Figma screen
  2. Copy the generated code
  3. Paste the code into page.tsx or any component your app.
  4. Paste the generated fonts and tailwind code into the corresponding files.
  5. Viola! Pixel-perfect code!


How to set up the React website

Below are the instructions to run your own React website, using Next.js and Tailwind CSS.


  1. Download Node.js (LTS) from the official website here.
  2. Next, install TypeScript using the command in your terminal: npm install -g typescript
  3. Create a Next.js app using the command in your terminal: npx create-next-app@latest
  4. Name your project your-project-name.
  5. On installation, spam enter to use the default settings for the prompts.
  6. Download Visual Studio Code here.
  7. Open Visual Studio Code, click File > Open Folder > your-project-name
  8. In the upper left, click Terminal (it could be hidden in the 3 dots), then New Terminal.
  9. In the Terminal, type npm i, then npm run dev.
  10. Hold ctrl and click the link next to Local:, should look something like: http://localhost:3000
  11. Congrats! Your Next.js app is running.
plugins.tagline: Turn Figma into a React and Tailwind CSS website for free

plugins.name: Xerus
plugins.description:
Xerus helps you to organize the texts of your designs while having powerful tools to automate your text workflow. It synchronizes your figma text and your Airtable database.


Xerus is for free! I am glad I can contribute to the community. Airtable has a free version too, that supports a maximum of text entries, please check their price plan to see which option is best for you.


Getting started

There are several ways to use Xerus in your project. In this website, I explain you step by step how to set up Xerus for your project. Do you want to change the language of all text in your design? Do you want to update all instances of a text? Xerus can do it for you.


Features

  • Text synchronization between Airtable database and Figma.
  • Multiple layer synchronization pointing to the same database entry.
  • Single layer synchronization.
  • Multiple database connections


Incoming features

Do you have suggestions to improve Xerus? Contact me!

  • Import/Export of PO files.
  • Support complex Airtable fields


Updates

  • 1.0: first release
  • 2.0: fixed bug with airtable token and improved the error messaging.
  • 3.0: added support texts with breaklines

plugins.name: Nova Variable Finder
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that helps you find and locate nodes that use specific Figma variables in your document.


Features


Node Finder

  1. Search for nodes using a variable ID (e.g. VariableID:1:335)
  2. Search for nodes using a variable name
  3. Click on results to select and zoom to the node in your document
  4. Supports all types of variable bindings


Deleted Variable Finder

Search for deleted variables in your document. Deleted variables are the variables that have been deleted from your variables collection but are referenced in somewhere in your document.


Note: This feature uses the Figma API to search for deleted variables. Unfortunately this API is only available for Entreprise tier client.


How to use


  1. Open the plugin
  2. Click on the "Deleted Variable Finder" tab
  3. Provide the your file ID and your personal access token
  4. Click on the "Search" button
  5. The plugin will search for deleted variables in your document and display the results in the "Results" section
  6. Click on a variable name to search for all the nodes that use this variable in your document
  7. Click on a node to select and zoom to the node in your document
plugins.tagline: Find variables in your file.

plugins.name: Auto Layer Numbering
plugins.description:
Auto Page Number


Automatically add and update page numbers in your Figma documents with ease!


Overview:

Auto Page Number is a Figma plugin designed to streamline your workflow when working with multi-frame projects. Instead of manually adding page numbers to each frame, this plugin automatically generates and updates them for you. Simply input your desired text layer name (default is "pageNumber"), and with a single click, the plugin will create or update the numbering across all frames in your document.
plugins.tagline: Automatically add and update page numbers in your Figma documents with ease!

plugins.name: Fonspector
plugins.description:
📝 Overview

Struggling to keep your typography consistent across frames without a design system in place? Fonspector makes it easy. This Figma plugin analyzes your project’s typography, offering instant insights to streamline your workflow. From refining a single frame to auditing an entire design system, Fonspector ensures consistency, identifies missing fonts and styles, and lets you navigate text elements effortlessly—all within your Figma workspace.


👉 Key Features

1. Comprehensive Frame Scanning

2. Multi-Font & Style Management

3. Detect Hidden Layers

4. Navigate to Text Elements


😤 How to Use

1. Select a Frame

2. Launch the Plugin

3. Initiate the Analysis by clicking the “Inspect” button

4. Explore Font Families

5. Navigate to Text Elements


📧 Support and Feedback

I'm excited to share Fonspector with the community as my first-ever plugin developed from scratch! Your feedback is invaluable for improving it. If you run into any issues, have suggestions, or need help, please reach out to me via email or leave a comment.

accepted.name: Harshil Patel
accepted.description: iOS Engineer turned Product Designer, passionate about Design.

plugins.tagline: Fonspector: Bringing Typography Consistency to Every Frame.
